columns.text: This exercise requires us to calculate the capital outlays.
**Capital outlay** or capital expenditure refers to the company's expenditures for the acquisition or to make improvements to capital assets.

First, let's identify the payment of accounts for every quarter. It is computed as follows:

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{Payment of Accounts} &= \text{Payment of NQ Sales} +\text{Payment of CQ Sales} \\[5pt]
&= \bigg(\text{NQ Sales}\times\text{75\%}\times{\frac{1}{3}}\bigg) + \bigg(\text{CQ Sales}\times\text{75\%}\times{\frac{2}{3}}\bigg)\\[2pt]
\end{aligned}$$


Where:

NQ  - Next Quarter

CQ - Current Quarter

Before we compute the payment of accounts, let's first identify the payment of NQ Sales by multiplying the next quarter by the percentage of forecast sales and one-third.

| |Q1 | Q2 |Q3 |Q4 | 
|--|--:|--:|--:|--:| 
| NQ Sales|$\text{\$2,065.00}$ |$\text{\$1,810.00}$ |$\text{\$1,530.00}$ |$\text{\$2,025.00}$ | 
| Multiply: Percentage of Forecast Sales|$\text{75\%}$ |$\text{75\%}$| $\text{75\%}$|$\text{75\%}$ | 
|Multiply: One-third |$\underline{\dfrac{1}{3}}$ | $\underline{\dfrac{1}{3}}$|$\underline{\dfrac{1}{3}}$ |$\underline{\dfrac{1}{3}}$ | 
| **Payment of NQ Sales**| $\underline{\underline{\text{\$ 516.25}}}$ | $\underline{\underline{\text{\$ 452.50}}}$  |  $\underline{\underline{\text{\$ 382.50}}}$ | $\underline{\underline{\text{\$ 506.25}}}$  |

Next, we will compute the payment of current quarter sales by multiplying the current quarter sales by the percentage of forecast sales and two-third.


| |Q1 | Q2 |Q3 |Q4 | 
|--|--:|--:|--:|--:| 
| CQ Sales|$\text{\$1,670}$ |$\text{\$2,065}$ |$\text{\$1,810}$ |$\text{\$1,530}$ | 
| Multiply: Percentage of Forecast Sales|$\text{75\%}$ |$\text{75\%}$| $\text{75\%}$|$\text{75\%}$ | 
|Multiply: One-third |$\underline{\dfrac{2}{3}}$ | $\underline{\dfrac{2}{3}}$|$\underline{\dfrac{2}{3}}$ |$\underline{\dfrac{2}{3}}$ | 
| **Payment of NQ Sales**| $\underline{\underline{\text{\$ 835}}}$ | $\underline{\underline{\text{\$ 1,032.50}}}$  |  $\underline{\underline{\text{\$ 905}}}$ | $\underline{\underline{\text{\$ 765}}}$  |

### Payments of Accounts

We can now compute the payments of accounts per quarter using the equation in step 4. 


| |Q1 |Q2 |Q3 |Q4 | 
|--|--:|--:|--:|--:| 
|Payment of NQ Sales |$\text{\$ 516.25}$ |$\text{\$ 452.50}$ |$\text{\$ 382.50}$ |$\text{\$ 506.25}$ | 
|Add: Payment of CQ Sales |$\underline{\text{835.00}}$ | $\underline{\text{1,032.50}}$|$\underline{\text{905.00}}$ |$\underline{\text{765.00}}$ | 
| **Payment of Accounts** | $\underline{\underline{\textbf{\$ 1,351.25}}}$ | $\underline{\underline{\textbf{\$ 1,485.00}}}$  |  $\underline{\underline{\textbf{\$ 1,287.50}}}$ | $\underline{\underline{\textbf{\$ 1,271.25}}}$  |

### Wages, taxes and other expenses

Next part of capital outlay is the wages, taxes and other expense. The problem mentioned that these expenses are 20 percent of sales. Therefore, it is computed by multiplying the sales per quarter by 20%.

| |Q1 | Q2 |Q3 |Q4 | 
|--|--:|--:|--:|--:| 
| CQ Sales|$\text{\$1,670}$ |$\text{\$2,065}$ |$\text{\$1,810}$ |$\text{\$1,530}$ | 
| Multiply: Percentage of Forecast Sales|$\underline{{\hspace{10pt}}\text{20\%}}$ |$\underline{{\hspace{10pt}}\text{20\%}}$| $\underline{{\hspace{10pt}}\text{20\%}}$|$\underline{{\hspace{10pt}}\text{20\%}}$ | 
| **Wages, taxes and other expenses**| $\underline{\underline{\textbf{\$ 334}}}$ | $\underline{\underline{\textbf{\$ 413}}}$  |  $\underline{\underline{\textbf{\$ 362}}}$ | $\underline{\underline{\textbf{\$ 306}}}$  |

Now that we have computed the payment of accounts and wages, taxes, and other expenses, we can calculate the total capital outlays per quarter. Note that the interest and dividends are $90.


| |Q1 | Q2 |Q3 |Q4 | 
|--|--:|--:|--:|--:| 
| Payment of Accounts|$\text{\$ 1,351.25}$ |$\text{\$ 1,485.00}$ |$\text{\$ 1,287.50}$ |$\text{\$ 1,271.25}$ | 
| Wages, taxes and other expenses|$\text{334.00}$ |$\text{413.00}$| $\text{362.00}$|$\text{306.00}$ | 
|Long-term financing expenses (Interest and Dividends) |$\underline{\hspace{10pt}\text{90.00}}$ | $\underline{\hspace{10pt}\text{90.00}}$ |$\underline{\hspace{10pt}\text{90.00}}$ |$\underline{\hspace{10pt}\text{90.00}}$  | 
| **Total Capital Outlay**| $\underline{\underline{\textbf{\$ 1,775.25}}}$ | $\underline{\underline{\textbf{\$ 1,988.00}}}$  |  $\underline{\underline{\textbf{\$ 1,739.50}}}$ | $\underline{\underline{\textbf{\$ 1,667.25}}}$  |
